Articles.Content: Is it possible to add kOS syntax highlighting to the "insert code" function in the forum post editor? If it is possible, how do we make it happen?

While not a koS user (yet, it is installed), I have traded code snippets for other works on other forums, and yes, having syntactically correct posts is a nice feature.  This forum engine is an off the shelf-ish engine they purchased.  The link to the engine developer is at the very bottom of the page, where you could probably find the info needed to make the requested change.  If the koS community could put together a list of what is needed, and hand the forum devs an easy to implement solution, I'd have to guess they'd be all for this.

And it uses CKEditor as an editor. Several CKEditor plugins are included and visible.

So, if create another one CKEditor syntax highlight plugin, probably it could be added by the forum admin.

Thank you for you replies @Gargamel and @kerbiloid. 

It looks like all we need is the kOS community to show some interest and do the work to create the syntax highlighting. Maybe some of the talented people from The kOS EditorTools Github could help with this. 

It would be really cool if we made this happen!
